description.p: You create a tiny glowing star in your hand. Until the spell ends, the star sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light is colored silver. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.
You can place a star on any surface to make this effect stationary.
You can decide to throw the star as a ranged spell attack after casting this spell or as an action afterwards. Doing that the star shatters dealing 1d6 radiant damage.
Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

The spell creates more than one star when you reach higher levels: two stars at 5th level, three stars at 11th level, and four stars at 17th level. you can direct the stars at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each star.

You create drop of liquid moonlight over the targeted creature. The drop lays onto the creature's skin or may enter their body to heal. The target regains hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier and has advantage on it's next attack. This spell has no effect on constructs.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment. This spell has no effect on evil or undead creatures.

You point at a location within range, and a glowing 1-foot-diameter ball of radiant energy streaks there and explodes in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9d6 radiant or force damage (your choice) damage and cannot become invisible. On a successful save, a creature takes half the damage and can turn invisible.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment.

You call out to the Moon and infuse a creature with magical moonlight to slightly transform the creature in a guardian of the Moon. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. The creature’s eyes begin to glow, and the hair appears as if made from silver water, and gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Magical darkvision with a range of 120 feet.
10 temporary hit points.
Advantage on Wisdom saving throws.
Weapon attacks are considered magical and deal an extra 1d6 radiant damage on a hit.

description.p: The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment. This spell has no effect on evil or undead creatures.

You point on a target within range and unleash a lunatic beam to strike it with immense force. The target can be a creature, an object, or a creation of magical force, such as the wall created by wall of force. On hit, the target takes 8d8 radiant or force damage (your choice) and must make a charisma saving throw. On a failed save the next attack against the target has advantage. Alternatively, the next saving throw of the target has disadvantage, whichever situation is first.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, roll an additional 1d8 of damage for each slot level above the 5th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment.

A shining figure glowing with moonlight appears at your shoulder, and reaches out to a creature within range. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If they fail, the grasp cleaves into their soul, inflicting 10d6 radiant or force damage (your choice) damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 30 hit points or fewer, they are instantly slain. If they succeed they receive half damage and do not get executed. Once the attack is made, the figure vanishes. If the target has a natural 20 on its saving throw, it receives no damage. On a natural 1 instead, the damage is doubled.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 and the hit point threshold increases by 5 per slot level above 5th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment.

A wave of healing moonlight washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to 4d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier and has advantage on it's next attack. This spell has no effect on constructs.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 6th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment. This spell has no effect on evil or undead creatures.

You summon a massive amount of moonlight that surrounds you, sparkling the air around your body and infusing you with glowing strength. Whenever a creature within 120 feet hits you with an attack or spell a spark of moonlight attempts to strike back. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 5d6 radiant or force damage (your choice) damage on a failed save. While Lunar Vengeance is active you have advantage on attack rolls and spell attack rolls that deal radiant damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 per slot level above 7th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment.

You call out to the Moon and infuse some creatures with magical moonlight. Choose a number of creatures up to your spellcasting ability modifier and transform them in guardians of the Moon. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. The creatures eyes begin to glow, and their hair appears as if made from silver water, and gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Magical darkvision with a range of 120 feet.
50 temporary hit points.
Advantage on any saving throw.
Weapon attacks are considered magical and deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage on a hit.
Spectral wings appear on their back, giving them a flying speed of 40 feet.
They have a +3 bonus to AC.

description.p: The caster of this spell must be a follower of Selûne and must not be undead nor have an evil alignment. This spell has no effect on evil or undead creatures.

You create a tiny shadowy star in your hand. Until the spell ends, the star overshadows any source of natural light within 30 feet. The star neutralizes only the light not the source, making it possible to have a campfire that sheds no light but still burns whatever touches the flame. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.
You can place a star on any surface to make this effect stationary.
You can decide to throw the star as a ranged spell attack after casting this spell or as an action afterwards. Doing that the star shatters dealing 1d6 necrotic damage.
Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

The spell creates more than one star when you reach higher levels: two stars at 5th level, three stars at 11th level, and four stars at 17th level. you can direct the stars at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each star.

On a successful save, a creature takes only half the damage. This spell has no effect on constructs.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3th.
The caster of this spell must be a follower of Shar and must not be celestial nor have a good alignment.

You conjure a swarm of sprectral crows which are hungry for blood and flesh. Choose a point within range, each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 4d4 piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to re-cast this spell to let the crows strike again without expending a spell slot.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1st.
